reference: John Abowd and Orley Ashenfelter. Unemployment and Compensating Wage Differentials, Princeton University Industrial Relations Section Working Paper No. 120, March 1979.
Gary Becker. Human Capital. Columbia University Press, New York, NY. 1964.
Charles Brown and James Medoff. Trade Unions in the Production Process, Journal of Political Economy. June 1978.
Kim Clark. The Impact of Unionization on Productivity: A Case Study, Industrial and Labor Relations Review. July 1980.
Alan Deardorff and Frank Stafford. Compensation of Cooperating Factors, Econometrica, July 1976.
Greg Duncan. Earnings Functions and Nonpecuniary Benefits, Journal of Human Resources. Fall 1976.
Greg Duncan and Frank Stafford. Do Union Members Receive Compensating Wage Differentials?, American Economic Review. June 1980.
Ronald Ehrenberg. Retirement System Characteristics and Compensating Wage Differentials in the Public Sector, Industrial and Labor Relations Review. July 1980.
James Ileckman. Sample Selection Bias as a Specification Error, Econometrica. January 1979.
Lung-Fei Lee. Unionism and Wage Rates: A Simultaneous Equations Model With Qualitative and Limited Dependent Variables, International Economic Review. June 1978.
James Medoff. Layoffs and Alternatives Under Trade Unions in U.S. Manu- facturing, American Economic Review. June 1979.
Dale Poirer. Partial Observability in Bivariate Probit Models, Journal of Econometrics. February 1980.
Robert S. Smith. The Occupational Safety and Health Act: Its Coals and Achievements. American Enterprise Institute, Washington, D.C. 1976.

Richard Thaler and Sherwin Rosen. The Value of Saving a Life: Evidence From the Labor Market, in Nester Terleckyj, ed., Household Production and Consumption. National Bureau of Economic Research, New York. 1975.
